sub_title: Fundraising and Membership Officer at ISCA
summary:
I am an adaptable, passionate and responsible Law graduate from the University of Sheffield, I also have a Masters Degree in International Criminology. During my degrees I have combined my studies with other commitments and work effectively, showing myself to be determined, resourceful, self-motivated, and capable of working under pressure. 

I have experience in multiple fields, from Sport Management, to Higher Education, to Sports Journalism. My main passion however lies in the Sport sector, especially in regards to grassroots sport.

The content of my degrees is something I am interested in outside just an academic context. While I have studied these subjects as part of my degree, my interest is based on an enthusiasm and engagement with the subject, rather than a pragmatic approach to developing a career. I have a particular interest in the sociological aspects of law, with special interests in organised crime, deprivation, and juvenile justice. I have also travelled independently to Luxembourg and Den Haag to attend the European Court of Justice and the International Court of Justice, where witnessing the prosecution of war crimes had a long lasting impact on my world view. I have an analytical mind that is practical when problem solving. I enjoy working on my own initiative or in a team.

In my spare time I play Water Polo and also write in depth analytical articles on Ice Hockey for multiple outlets. Overall I am dependable, trustworthy, and diligent, with a passion to learn new skills.

company.name: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association

profile_positions.company: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association
profile_positions.description:
At ISCA my role has two main aspects. The first is fundraising, where I search for new funding opportunities for the organisation, both public and private, help create partnership groups for potential projects and actions, and then write fundraising applications of various types.

Alongside my work fundraising for the organisation I also work with membership. As an international  umbrella association with 70+ active members, bringing new members on-board, as well as maintaining current membership, is vital. In my role I therefore liaise with potential new members, highlighting the synergies and benefits that membership to ISCA would bring to organisations, as well as work with current members to see how they can best take advantage of being an ISCA member, and ensuring that our goals and their goals align as best as possible.

Alongside these two key areas I also work on aspects of event management and well as advocacy.
profile_positions.title: Fundraising and Membership Officer

profile_positions.description:
Provide content for The Athletic Philadelphia on the Philadelphia Flyers, generally around three articles per month. Specifically focus on young players and prospects, as well as European based players.

Have attended two consecutive IIHF World Championship events in Denmark (2018) and Slovakia (2019) to cover Flyers players in attendance, interviewing more than ten of the World's best players, as well as featuring on the official IIHF podcast - The Totally Ice Hockey Show with James Richardson - five times during the 2019 edition of the tournament. (https://www.iihf.com/en/events/2019/wm/static/10469/podcast)

I have also appeared on multiple other hockey based podcasts in Sweden and America, been consulted by Swiss national television on the Great British National team, as well as by Canadian regional television on prospects, and been quoted in major Swedish newspapers. I have also, from time to time, been approached by professional team scouts and staff to offer additional input on players.

Ice Hockey Twitter account: https://twitter.com/avappleyard?lang=en
Example of work: https://theathletic.com/94132/2017/09/05/flyers-prospect-watch-david-kase/
profile_positions.title: Feature Writer, Ice Hockey

profile_positions.description:
At EFDN I head the Fundraising Department, overseeing all areas related to fundraising within the organisation.

This means overseeing short and long term strategies related to fundraising, finding opportunities for public and private funding, partnership building and management, project ideation and project application writing. 

Over the course of my time with the organisation I have led on seven successful European funding applications across a range of diverse sport-related topics, from Sustainability to Disability and Prisoner Reintegration to Diversity. These successful applications have benefitted more than 40 member organisations of the network, including some of the biggest football clubs and leagues in Europe.

Partnership building has also been a major part of the role, putting in place diverse, international consortiums for each project and ensuring that their needs are met while balancing that with the aims of EFDN alongside the policy considerations that are relevant to the success of a project.

The role also entails assisting members of the network build their own fundraising capacity through assistance, advice and informal training, as well as reporting and administration.
profile_positions.title: Fundraising Manager

profile_positions.description: As a cycling development officer at Cycling UK I work within the The Behaviour Change and Development Team to develop the Big Bike Revival and Community Cycle Clubs in Coventry and Solihull, alongside promoting active transport and travel by bicycle in the region at all levels.
profile_positions.title: Cycling Development Officer (Coventry and Solihull)

company.name: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association

profile_positions.company: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association
profile_positions.description:
I was brought on-board for the 2021 Erasmus+ Sport application deadline to be the lead on a Not-for-profit European sports event project application for €300,000. The projects topic was street football, specifically Panna, and using it as a tool for social inclusion. 

I led the development of the project idea alongside the main partners, acted as the liaison point between all partners, was the sole researcher in the development of the project, wrote the application in its entirety, and budgeted the project.

The outcome of the application will be confirmed in Autumn of 2021.
profile_positions.title: Fundraising Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As opportunities coordinator for sport & inclusion I am responsible for making sport at the university as easily accessible as possible, in turn trying to ensure that everyone at the university has the opportunity to be physically active.

The main part of this role is as project manager for the All In pilot project. This project involves the creation of an accreditation system for sports teams at the university that encourages teams to review their current practice, and make positive changes in five areas (General club culture, LGBTQ+, mental health, race & nationality and widening participation) going forward. 

The role also entails: planning and providing training opportunities for those involved in sport at the university, helping teams make links with external and internal organisations, planning a landmark disability sport fixture, researching inclusion within sport, creating documentation, surveys and a guide for the project, producing media pieces about teams and individuals, and reporting on the project.
profile_positions.title: Opportunities Coordinator (Sport & Inclusion), All In project manager

company.name: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association

profile_positions.company: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association
profile_positions.description:
I was brought on-board for the 2020 Erasmus+ Sport application deadline to be the lead on a Not-for-profit European sports event project application for €500,000. 

I led the development of the project idea alongside the main partners, acted as the liaison point between all partners, was the sole researcher in the development of the project, wrote the application in its entirety, and budgeted the project.
profile_positions.title: Fundraising Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked at a residential summer educational camp for teenagers from around the world.

My role involved leading the teenagers in attendance in sporting activities, cultural activities, and trips around the UK. In this capacity I supervised them, activated them, and ensured that they were safe. Additionally I planned certain activities myself, created games for them to play, and taught them new skills.
profile_positions.title: Sports and Activities Leader

company.name: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association

profile_positions.company: ISCA - International Sport and Culture Association
profile_positions.description:
Worked for one of the leading organisations within the Grassroots Sport sector. The role was multi-faceted, but daily tasks generally involved communications based tasks such as; updating social media accounts and websites, creating social media posts and plans, liaising with partners, as well as writing articles and reports, and editing other peoples work.

Fundraising was also a major part of the role, and I was the lead writer on three different EU Erasmus+ project applications with a combined value of just under €600,000. Additionally I assisted with more than ten other project applications over my time with ISCA, and was also an editor for project applications.

The role also entailed helping to organise major international events - including conferences, the European Week of Sport, major European projects, events at European Parliament and sports events - around Europe and assisting with running them smoothly. Such aspects of the job meant that communication and organisational skills were vital, as well as adaptability and intercultural understanding.

Furthermore I also assisted with graphical content at times, interviewed MEP's and partners, filmed events and interviews, assisted partners with travel and accommodation arrangements, and was part of a two man team that devised and created the ISCA mascot.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator, Communications Officer and Fundraising

profile_positions.description:
Contributed on a weekly basis for over a year to one of the leading websites covering the Philadelphia Flyers of the NHL. Pieces mainly involved prospect coverage, European hockey articles, as well as pieces that statistically analysed players and trends within hockey, specifically pertaining to the Philadelphia Flyers. While I no longer write frequently for the outlet due to other commitments I still provide sporadic articles.

http://sonsofpenn.com/
profile_positions.title: Sports Feature Writer, Ice Hockey

volunteer_experiences.description: As an experienced player and leader I was invited to coach youth players. I found this role extremely fulfilling, though at times challenging, as dealing with 9-13 year old's sensitively but confidently while ensuring their continued enjoyment of the sport, and development as a player required patience, communication, understanding and application.
